definition: The term refers to the bottom or floor of a large body of water, typically an ocean or sea. It is commonly used in the context of marine exploration, geology, or environmental studies to describe the underwater terrain or topography.

examples.german: Der Meeresgrund ist mit Korallen bedeckt.
examples.english: The seabed is covered with corals.
Fish live at the bottom of the sea.
The seabed is full of shells.

examples.german: Der Meeresgrund ist ein wichtiger Lebensraum.
examples.english: The seabed is an important habitat.
